glsa.title: Macromedia Flash Player: Remote arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been identified that allows arbitrary code execution on a user's system via the handling of malicious SWF files.

background.p: The Macromedia Flash Player is a renderer for the popular SWF filetype which is commonly used to provide interactive websites, digital experiences and mobile content.

description.p: When handling a SWF file, the Macromedia Flash Player incorrectly validates the frame type identifier stored in the SWF file which is used as an index to reference an array of function pointers. A specially crafted SWF file can cause this index to reference memory outside of the scope of the Macromedia Flash Player, which in turn can cause the Macromedia Flash Player to use unintended memory address(es) as function pointers.

impact.p: An attacker serving a maliciously crafted SWF file could entice a user to view the SWF file and execute arbitrary code on the user's machine.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
